segment.source: Registering SPNs for the application pool account
segment.target: Registering SPNs for the application pool account

segment.source: To enable the MBAM Servers to authenticate communication from the Administration and Monitoring Website and the Self-Service Portal, you must register a Service Principal Name (SPN) for the host name under the domain account that you are using for the web application pool.
segment.target: To enable the MBAM Servers to authenticate communication from the Administration and Monitoring Website and the Self-Service Portal, you must register a Service Principal Name (SPN) for the host name under the domain account that you are using for the web application pool.

segment.source: Review the information in the following table before you start creating SPNs.

segment.source: More information

segment.source: Create a service account in Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS).
segment.target: Create a service account in Active Directory Domain Services (AD DS).

segment.source: The service account is a user account that you create in AD DS to provide security for the MBAM websites.
segment.target: The service account is a user account that you create in AD DS to provide security for the MBAM websites.

segment.source: The MBAM websites run under an application pool, whose identity is the name of the service account.
segment.target: The MBAM websites run under an application pool, whose identity is the name of the service account.

segment.source: The SPNs are then registered in the application pool account.
segment.target: The SPNs are then registered in the application pool account.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You must use the same application pool account for all web servers.
segment.target: You must use the same application pool account for all web servers.

segment.source: Verify that either the IIS-IUSRS group account or the application pool account has been granted the necessary rights.
segment.target: Verify that either the IIS-IUSRS group account or the application pool account has been granted the necessary rights.

segment.source: To check this, follow these steps:
segment.target: To check this, follow these steps:

segment.source: Open the Local Security Policy editor and expand the Local Policies node.
segment.target: Open the Local Security Policy editor and expand the Local Policies node.

segment.source: Select the User Rights Assignment node, and double-click the Impersonate a client after authentication and Log on as a batch job Group Policy settings in the right pane.
segment.target: Select the User Rights Assignment node, and double-click the Impersonate a client after authentication and Log on as a batch job Group Policy settings in the right pane.
